alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Northwestern San Juan Mountains; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 03 at 4:33PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW BAND... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 432 PM MDT, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Slick Rock to 8 miles southeast of Dove Creek to 6 miles northwest of Dolores to Cortez and moving northeast at 25 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Dolores around 450 PM MDT. Norwood around 530 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 27 and 32, and between mile markers 52 and 53. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 34 and 47. Colorado 90 between mile markers 30 and 33. Colorado 141 between mile markers 20 and 63. Colorado 145 between mile markers 1 and 39, and between mile markers 98 and 116. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
